heading: va buys part of linux hardware
subheading: the linux hardware market is consolidating as leader va research on wednesday purchases a portion of linux hardware systems.
author: wired news report
text: continuing its rapid expansion, linux leader va research has signed a letter of intent to acquire assets of linux hardware solutions. the reorganized company will produce commercial products under the name va linux systems, and will continue research and development efforts under the name va linux labs.the company said in a statement wednesday that it has "reorganized to focus on commercial products while aggressively furthering linux research and development."as part of the deal, linux hardware systems president kit cosper will become the primary adviser for va's service and support organization, reporting to va vice president john hall.in late march, va acquired linux marketing and consulting company electric lichen. this followed an announcement earlier that month of an investment in the company by intel.
